Posted By: MilfHunter (10/6/2009 12:27:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Definitely a good card. Unless you're playing white you're going to have trouble getting rid of him permanently. 2 damage may not seem like much, but when it comes out as early as turn 2 and can just keep on coming, it's pretty dandy. Also works really well with other cards like Quest for the Gravelord and Blade of the Bloodchief, as well as fodder for the opponent playing something like a kicked Gatekeeper. It even works as great discard fodder, as you can effectively get a free cast of it by playing a land.
posts.html:

Posted By: tantallum99 (9/22/2010 6:55:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I finished a guy on 8 life with four of these, after a long and good game against [Halimar Excavator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Halimar Excavator) and his UW ally friends. He just asked me "...really?"  
I run both [Quest for the Gravelord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for the Gravelord), [Pawn of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pawn of Ulamog) and bloodthrone, and this guy fits in perfectly. He's even better with a sword or the frightening [Basilisk Collar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Basilisk Collar).  
But yeah, one of the best vampires, probably second only to [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) since nocturnus will leave us soon. 4.5/5
posts.html:
I finished a guy on 8 life with four of these, after a long and good game against Halimar Excavator and his UW ally friends. He just asked me "...really?"
I run both Quest for the Gravelord, Pawn of Ulamog and bloodthrone, and this guy fits in perfectly. He's even better with a sword or the frightening Basilisk Collar.
But yeah, one of the best vampires, probably second only to Vampire Nighthawk since nocturnus will leave us soon. 4.5/5

Posted By: Paleopaladin (8/27/2010 4:40:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
i've never played against someone who used a bloodghast, and for that i am thankful. Anyone who bashes this clearly can't comprehend it.  
1. It's a vampire, a tribal that is growing in strength and popularity.  
2. It's a 2/1 for BB that comes back whenever you play a land.  
3. the 10 or less life aspect is so common that you'll have enough vampires from the zendikar block alone to take someone down to 10 or below pretty quickly.  
4. He can't black. That's not a good thing, but for anyone who thinks that, when you really need a blocker you're only going to have out a bloodghast, you obviously aren't playing vampires right. Zendikar vampire's aren't huge things like [soul collector](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soul collector) or [stalking bloodsucker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=stalking bloodsucker), they're little weenies that you get out on turn 1 or 2.  
Oh no! my bloodghast is out but it can't block!... Oh wait! nevermind i'll just block with [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire) and sac bloodghast to it if need be. Land on my next turn and... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Don't like it it's well weak, who cares how many times it comes back if it's weak? Who ever got so excited about a 2/1 tapping to attack? No matter how often it does it it's not gonna win a game. Block it, end of. It's a 2/1 for Christ Sake.   
  
The only time this is any good is with Kalastria Highborn. But Even then anyone with any sense will kill Kalastria first so it won't be all that. Honestly though, I've never understood this card so if someone is willing to explain something that I'm not seeing then I'd appreciate it.
